results.title: The Crescent wing
results.brief_description: The problems of wing-design in high-speed long-range aeroplanes. With the aid of diagrams and smoke-tunnel photography the film explains in basic terms the relative advantages and disadvantages of varying thickness and span of wings and degree of sweepback. The solution arrived at by the designers is the crescent-shaped win used in the Victor 4-engines jet bomber, which is shown in flight and landing.

results.title: The Creepy Crawley's
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Beck Cole and Citt Williams
results.brief_description:
The Creepy Crawleys, a documentary film, is set in an isolated Australian country town and tells the story of Monte Cristo, a mysterious old mansion and its owners, past and present.
Contains b&w archival stills.

results.title: The Creative stitch
results.creator_credit: Creative Embroidery Association and Jack Joynes
results.brief_description: With so many techniques to explore, a wide variety of materials to be used and so many stitches to be devised, embroidery can be an expressive language. Ideas from nature and painting an be transferred to string embroidery, machine embroidery and other methods of needle weaving.
results.description: With so many techniques to explore, a wide variety of materials to be used and so many stitches to be devised, embroidery can be an expressive language. results.title: The Creative person: Tyrone Guthrie
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television and Joyce Chopra
results.brief_description: A profile of Tyrone Guthrie the eminent theatrical director, showing him in several locales while he works, lectures and relaxes. In interviews he discusses his general philosophy towards the theatre as a medium. June Havoc and Darren McGavin describe the feelings which most actors have towards working with Guthrie.

results.title: The Creative eye: thoughts on painting by some contemporary artists
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and David Muir
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Australian eye V”.
The film is intended as a background to the whole “Australian eye” collection. Ten artists, with a variety of styles, are shown working on their paintings and talking about their problems. Students seeing the film should quickly realise that all true artists have to evolve their own methods of realising ideas and that there is no magic formula for achieving good paintings. Artists includes Sally Robinson, Col Jorden, Terrence O’Donnell, Rod Milgate, Suzanne Archer, Peter Powditch, John Firth-Smith, Kevin Conner, Ann Thompson and Alan Oldfield.

results.title: The Creation of the world
results.brief_description: Marcel Marceau performs one of his “Pantomimes”, this one dealing with the creation of the world. The film captures the beauty and meaning of the art of mime by one of the world’s masters of this ancient art.

results.title: The Creation
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Robin James and Peter Cooke
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Dreamtime story”.
In this imaginative interpretation of an Aboriginal creation myth, the spirits, Baime and Yhi breathe life into the planet Earth, creating plants and animals. However the animals quarrel, causing the Earth to split, releasing the evil spirit Marmoo, who destroys Baime and Yhi’s creation with fire. Baime punishes Marmoo by turning him into a snake. New forests grow from surviving seeds and the animals return but without Baime’s spirit, which he now breathes into his last creations, Man and Woman. Narrated by Bill Lowah.

results.title: The Crazy stranger = Gadjo dilo [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Princes Films, Guy Marignane and Tony Gatlif
results.brief_description: Stephane is a young Parisian travelling through a remote area of Romania in search of a legendary singer whom he hopes to record. He encounters Izidor, a wizened gypsy who is bemoaning the imprisonment of his son, who takes Stephane under his wing. With a guide and patron to steer him through the chaotic and suspicion-driven world of the gypsies, Stephane soon becomes engrossed in a rambunctious lifelstyle which celebrates life through singing, drinking and cursing. In French and Romanian with English subtitles. Cast includes: Romaine Duris, Rona Hartner, Izidor Serban and Florin Moldovan. (Awards: include Paris Film Festival 1998; Locarno International Film Festival 1997 and Brussels International Film Festival 1998)

results.title: The Crawl
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the various movements necessary for the perfection of the crawl stroke in swimming, including regulation of breathing, and leg and arm action. Underwater and slow-motion photography are used extensively.
